channel.title: Comments on: Milk
channel.description: Scattered pages from an apocryphal diary

item.title: By: Drey
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description: I remember when I first saw you pour orange juice in your cereal. I mentally filed it away so that I could bring it out again if you questioned any of my idiosyncrasies.
item.content:encoded: I remember when I first saw you pour orange juice in your cereal. I mentally filed it away so that I could bring it out again if you questioned any of my idiosyncrasies.

item.title: By: Beth
item.dc:creator: Beth
item.description: Cereal with orange juice FTW. Really, it works. Obviously not with all cereals (like Cookie Crisp, I'm guessing), but it works with neutral cereals, like Cheerios, Corn Flakes, Rice Krispies, etc.
item.content:encoded: Cereal with orange juice FTW. Really, it works. Obviously not with all cereals (like Cookie Crisp, I’m guessing), but it works with neutral cereals, like Cheerios, Corn Flakes, Rice Krispies, etc.

item.title: By: Drey
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description: I think I tried the no wheat thing for a while and it didn't have a noticeable effect other then preventing me from eating almost everything I liked.
item.content:encoded: I think I tried the no wheat thing for a while and it didn’t have a noticeable effect other then preventing me from eating almost everything I liked.

item.title: By: Monica
item.dc:creator: Monica
item.description: Could be the wheat in the cereal rather than the milk? I hate it that a person has to resort to this sort of scientific inquiry... :(
item.content:encoded: Could be the wheat in the cereal rather than the milk? I hate it that a person has to resort to this sort of scientific inquiry… üôÅ

item.title: By: Kristin
item.dc:creator: Kristin
item.description: Now you can have steamed drinks at my house without bringing your own separate milk.
item.content:encoded: Now you can have steamed drinks at my house without bringing your own separate milk.
